alert.note: Alert for Hamblen; Jefferson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 4:09PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jefferson, Grainger and western Hamblen Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 509 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New Market, or 9 miles southwest of Jefferson City, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morristown, Jefferson City, Rutledge, Bean Station, New Market, Blaine, Thorn Hill, Panther Creek State Park, Alpha and Joppa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
